title: Understanding Complex Trauma
text: Complex trauma refers to the experience of multiple, chronic, and prolonged traumatic events, often of an interpersonal nature. It is different from a single traumatic event.

hintAnswer: when an individual is exposed over time to multiple recurring traumatic events (Cenat, 2022). This type of trauma can be sexual, physical, or psychological in nature.
title: Identifying Complex Trauma
text: Which of the following best describes complex trauma?
choices: feeling like the past trauma is reoccurring or that the person is in an unsafe situation as they were when the trauma occurred
when an individual is exposed over time to multiple recurring traumatic events (Cenat, 2022). This type of trauma can be sexual, physical, or psychological in nature.
helps people face and control their fear by gradually exposing them to the trauma they experienced in a safe way
